sentences.english: Black Bart did have his quirks as well.
It is a big foible of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很大的怪癖全體人民。

sentences.english: Mr Sengoku was also scathing about Japan’s habit of using public money to rescue bankrupt firms.
sentences.chinese: 由人先生還批評日本用公款救助行將倒閉公司的怪癖。

sentences.english: The same irrational quirk is now playing out in the U.S. housing market.
sentences.chinese: 同樣不合理的怪癖，正在美國房地產市場出現。

sentences.english: I know you’ll forgive my eccentricities, she said.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你會原諒我的怪癖的，她說。

sentences.english: But the prizewinners also have some quirks.
sentences.chinese: 然而得獎人也有一些怪癖。
你如何變得帶有怪癖呢？

sentences.english: Some will see this as a lovable, or at least typical, form of British eccentricity.
sentences.chinese: 有人認爲這是一種可愛的，或至少典型的英國式怪癖。

sentences.english: His wiles and quirks do not diminish his humanity .
sentences.chinese: 他的把戲和怪癖無損於他的人道精神。

sentences.english: Even you! If your partner's quirks are endearing or tolerable, you're in good shape.
sentences.chinese: 如果你伴侶的怪癖是可以忍受的，那你還挺不錯的。

sentences.english: He had a tumour. When it had been removed, his paedophilic tendencies went away.
sentences.chinese: 當他的腦瘤被割除的時候，他那些怪癖消失了。
你能接受你伴侶的怪癖。

sentences.english: It is a big foible of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個全體人民的大怪癖。

sentences.english: Her ex-boyfriends parted with her because of her peculiarity.
sentences.chinese: 她的前男友們就是因爲她的這個怪癖而跟她分手。

sentences.english: This is an innatte eccentricity of human nature.

definition: to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
